ElementInternals.summary: The ElementInternals interface of the Document Object Model gives web developers a way to allow custom elements to fully participate in HTML forms. It provides utilities for working with these elements in the same way you would work with any standard HTML form element, and also exposes the Accessibility Object Model to the element.

remarks.para:
-More capable form controls via web.dev (2019)
-Creating custom form controls with ElementInternals via CSS-tricks (2021)

ElementInternalsAriaModal.summary: The ariaModal property of the interface reflects the value of the aria-modal attribute, which indicates whether an element is modal when displayed.

blockquote.para: Setting aria attributes on ElementInternals allows default semantics to be defined on a custom element. These may be overwritten by author-defined attributes, but ensure that default semantics are retained should the author delete those attributes, or fail to add them at all. For more information see the Accessibility Object Model explainer.

remarks.para: -ARIA: dialog role

ElementInternalsAriaModal.value: A string with one of the following values:

ElementInternalsWillValidate.summary: The willValidate read-only property of the interface returns true if the element is a submittable element that is a candidate for constraint validation.

remarks.para: Elements that are barred from being candidates for constraint validation include those that have the attributes: disabled, hidden or readonly, input elements of type=button or type=reset, or any element that is a datalist element or has a <datalist> element ancestor.

ElementInternalsWillValidate.value: true if the element is a candidate for constraint validation, otherwise false.

ElementInternalsValidity.summary: The validity read-only property of the interface returns a object which represents the different validity states the element can be in, with respect to constraint validation.

ElementInternalsAriaColIndexText.summary: The ariaColIndexText property of the interface reflects the value of the aria-colindextext attribute, which defines a human readable text alternative of aria-colindex.

blockquote.para: Setting aria attributes on ElementInternals allows default semantics to be defined on a custom element. These may be overwritten by author-defined attributes, but ensure that default semantics are retained should the author delete those attributes, or fail to add them at all. For more information see the Accessibility Object Model explainer.

remarks.para: -ARIA: table role

ElementInternalsAriaOrientation.summary: The ariaOrientation property of the interface reflects the value of the aria-orientation attribute, which indicates whether the element's orientation is horizontal, vertical, or unknown/ambiguous.

blockquote.para: Setting aria attributes on ElementInternals allows default semantics to be defined on a custom element. These may be overwritten by author-defined attributes, but ensure that default semantics are retained should the author delete those attributes, or fail to add them at all. For more information see the Accessibility Object Model explainer.

ElementInternalsAriaOrientation.value: A string with one of the following values:

ElementInternalsAriaBrailleRoleDescripti.summary: The ariaBrailleRoleDescription property of the interface reflects the value of the aria-brailleroledescription attribute, which defines the ARIA braille role description of the element.

remarks.para:
This property may be used to provide an abbreviated version of the aria-roledescription value.
It should only be used if aria-roledescription is present and in the rare case where it is too verbose for braille.
The aria-brailleroledescription contains additional information about when the property should be set.
-ARIA roles

ElementInternalsAriaBrailleRoleDescripti.value: A string that is intended to be converted into braille.

ElementInternalsAriaMultiLine.summary: The ariaMultiLine property of the interface reflects the value of the aria-multiline attribute, which indicates whether a text box accepts multiple lines of input or only a single line.

blockquote.para: Setting aria attributes on ElementInternals allows default semantics to be defined on a custom element. These may be overwritten by author-defined attributes, but ensure that default semantics are retained should the author delete those attributes, or fail to add them at all. For more information see the Accessibility Object Model explainer.

remarks.para: -ARIA: textbox role

ElementInternalsAriaMultiLine.value: A string with one of the following values:

ElementInternalsAriaBusy.summary: The ariaBusy property of the interface reflects the value of the aria-busy attribute, which indicates whether an element is being modified, as assistive technologies may want to wait until the modifications are complete before exposing them to the user.

blockquote.para: Setting aria attributes on ElementInternals allows default semantics to be defined on a custom element. These may be overwritten by author-defined attributes, but ensure that default semantics are retained should the author delete those attributes, or fail to add them at all. For more information see the Accessibility Object Model explainer.

ElementInternalsAriaBusy.value: A string with one of the following values:

ElementInternalsAriaSetSize.summary: The ariaSetSize property of the interface reflects the value of the aria-setsize attribute, which defines the number of items in the current set of listitems or treeitems.

blockquote.para: Setting aria attributes on ElementInternals allows default semantics to be defined on a custom element. These may be overwritten by author-defined attributes, but ensure that default semantics are retained should the author delete those attributes, or fail to add them at all. For more information see the Accessibility Object Model explainer.

remarks.para: -ARIA: tab role

ElementInternalsAriaSort.summary: The ariaSort property of the interface reflects the value of the aria-sort attribute, which indicates if items in a table or grid are sorted in ascending or descending order.

blockquote.para: Setting aria attributes on ElementInternals allows default semantics to be defined on a custom element. These may be overwritten by author-defined attributes, but ensure that default semantics are retained should the author delete those attributes, or fail to add them at all. For more information see the Accessibility Object Model explainer.

remarks.para: -ARIA: table role

ElementInternalsAriaSort.value: A string with one of the following values:

ElementInternalsAriaChecked.summary: The ariaChecked property of the interface reflects the value of the aria-checked attribute, which indicates the current "checked" state of checkboxes, radio buttons, and other widgets that have a checked state.

blockquote.para: Setting aria attributes on ElementInternals allows default semantics to be defined on a custom element. These may be overwritten by author-defined attributes, but ensure that default semantics are retained should the author delete those attributes, or fail to add them at all. For more information see the Accessibility Object Model explainer.

remarks.para: -ARIA: checkbox role

ElementInternalsAriaChecked.value: A string with one of the following values:

ElementInternalsAriaExpanded.summary: The ariaExpanded property of the interface reflects the value of the aria-expanded attribute, which indicates whether a grouping element owned or controlled by this element is expanded or collapsed.

blockquote.para: Setting aria attributes on ElementInternals allows default semantics to be defined on a custom element. These may be overwritten by author-defined attributes, but ensure that default semantics are retained should the author delete those attributes, or fail to add them at all. For more information see the Accessibility Object Model explainer.

ElementInternalsAriaExpanded.value: A string with one of the following values:

ElementInternalsAriaAtomic.summary: The ariaAtomic property of the interface reflects the value of the aria-atomic attribute, which indicates whether assistive technologies will present all, or only parts of, the changed region based on the change notifications defined by the aria-relevant attribute.

blockquote.para: Setting aria attributes on ElementInternals allows default semantics to be defined on a custom element. These may be overwritten by author-defined attributes, but ensure that default semantics are retained should the author delete those attributes, or fail to add them at all. For more information see the Accessibility Object Model explainer.

ElementInternalsAriaAtomic.value: A string with one of the following values:

ElementInternalsSetValidity.summary: The setValidity() method of the interface sets the validity of the element.

ElementInternalsAriaRequired.summary: The ariaRequired property of the interface reflects the value of the aria-required attribute, which indicates that user input is required on the element before a form may be submitted.

blockquote.para: Setting aria attributes on ElementInternals allows default semantics to be defined on a custom element. These may be overwritten by author-defined attributes, but ensure that default semantics are retained should the author delete those attributes, or fail to add them at all. For more information see the Accessibility Object Model explainer.

remarks.para: -ARIA: textbox role

ElementInternalsAriaRequired.value: A string with one of the following values:

ElementInternalsAriaPlaceholder.summary: The ariaPlaceholder property of the interface reflects the value of the aria-placeholder attribute, which defines a short hint intended to aid the user with data entry when the control has no value.

blockquote.para: Setting aria attributes on ElementInternals allows default semantics to be defined on a custom element. These may be overwritten by author-defined attributes, but ensure that default semantics are retained should the author delete those attributes, or fail to add them at all. For more information see the Accessibility Object Model explainer.

remarks.para: -ARIA: textbox role

ElementInternalsAriaControlsElements.summary:
The ariaControlsElements property of the interface is an array containing the element (or elements) that are controlled by the element it is applied to.
For example, this might be set on a combobox to indicate the element that it pops up, or on a scrollbar to indicate the ID of the element it controls.

remarks.para: The aria-controls topic contains additional information about how the attribute and property should be used.

-aria-controls attribute
-
-Reflected element references in the Attribute reflection guide

ElementInternalsAriaControlsElements.value:
An array of subclasses of , representing the elements that are controlled by this element.When read, the returned array is a static and read-only.
When written, the assigned array is copied: subsequent changes to the array do not affect the value of the property.

ElementInternalsAriaActiveDescendantElem.summary: The ariaActiveDescendantElement property of the interface represents the current active element when focus is on a composite widget, combobox, textbox, group, or application.

remarks.para: The aria-activedescendant topic contains additional information about how the attribute and property should be used.

-aria-activedescendant attribute
-
-Reflected element references in the Attribute reflection guide.

ElementInternalsAriaActiveDescendantElem.value: An subclass of that represents the active descendant, or null if there is no active descendant.

ElementInternalsAriaDescribedByElements.summary:
The ariaDescribedByElements property of the interface is an array containing the element (or elements) that provide an accessible description for the element it is applied to.
The accessible description is similar to the accessible label (see ), but provides more verbose information.

remarks.para: The aria-describedby topic contains additional information about how the attribute and property should be used.

-aria-describedby attribute
-
-Reflected element references in the Attribute reflection guide

ElementInternalsAriaDescribedByElements.value:
An array of subclasses of .
The inner text of these elements can be joined with spaces to get the accessible description.When read, the returned array is a static and read-only.
When written, the assigned array is copied: subsequent changes to the array do not affect the value of the property.

ElementInternalsAriaLive.summary: The ariaLive property of the interface reflects the value of the aria-live attribute, which indicates that an element will be updated, and describes the types of updates the user agents, assistive technologies, and user can expect from the live region.

blockquote.para: Setting aria attributes on ElementInternals allows default semantics to be defined on a custom element. These may be overwritten by author-defined attributes, but ensure that default semantics are retained should the author delete those attributes, or fail to add them at all. For more information see the Accessibility Object Model explainer.

ElementInternalsAriaLive.value: A string with one of the following values:

ElementInternalsAriaAutoComplete.summary: The ariaAutoComplete property of the interface reflects the value of the aria-autocomplete attribute, which indicates whether inputting text could trigger display of one or more predictions of the user's intended value for a combobox, searchbox, or textbox and specifies how predictions would be presented if they were made.

blockquote.para: Setting aria attributes on ElementInternals allows default semantics to be defined on a custom element. These may be overwritten by author-defined attributes, but ensure that default semantics are retained should the author delete those attributes, or fail to add them at all. For more information see the Accessibility Object Model explainer.

ElementInternalsAriaAutoComplete.value: A string with one of the following values:

ElementInternalsAriaRowIndexText.summary: The ariaRowIndexText property of the interface reflects the value of the aria-rowindextext attribute, which defines a human readable text alternative of aria-rowindex.

blockquote.para: Setting aria attributes on ElementInternals allows default semantics to be defined on a custom element. These may be overwritten by author-defined attributes, but ensure that default semantics are retained should the author delete those attributes, or fail to add them at all. For more information see the Accessibility Object Model explainer.

remarks.para: -ARIA: table role

ElementInternalsAriaRowSpan.summary: The ariaRowSpan property of the interface reflects the value of the aria-rowspan attribute, which defines the number of rows spanned by a cell or gridcell within a table, grid, or treegrid.

blockquote.para: Setting aria attributes on ElementInternals allows default semantics to be defined on a custom element. These may be overwritten by author-defined attributes, but ensure that default semantics are retained should the author delete those attributes, or fail to add them at all. For more information see the Accessibility Object Model explainer.

remarks.para: -ARIA: table role

ElementInternalsAriaRowSpan.value: A string which contains an integer.

ElementInternalsAriaDisabled.summary: The ariaDisabled property of the interface reflects the value of the aria-disabled attribute, which indicates that the element is perceivable but disabled, so it is not editable or otherwise operable.

blockquote.para: Setting aria attributes on ElementInternals allows default semantics to be defined on a custom element. These may be overwritten by author-defined attributes, but ensure that default semantics are retained should the author delete those attributes, or fail to add them at all. For more information see the Accessibility Object Model explainer.

ElementInternalsAriaDisabled.value: A string with one of the following values:

ElementInternalsAriaColIndex.summary: The ariaColIndex property of the interface reflects the value of the aria-colindex attribute, which defines an element's column index or position with respect to the total number of columns within a table, grid, or treegrid.

blockquote.para: Setting aria attributes on ElementInternals allows default semantics to be defined on a custom element. These may be overwritten by author-defined attributes, but ensure that default semantics are retained should the author delete those attributes, or fail to add them at all. For more information see the Accessibility Object Model explainer.

remarks.para: -ARIA: table role

ElementInternalsAriaColIndex.value: A string which contains an integer.

ElementInternalsAriaBrailleLabel.summary: The ariaBrailleLabel property of the interface reflects the value of the aria-braillelabel attribute, which defines the ARIA braille label of the element.

remarks.para:
This element label may be used by assistive technologies that can present content in braille, but should only be set if a braille-specific label would improve the user experience.
The aria-braillelabel contains additional information about when the property should be set.

ElementInternalsAriaBrailleLabel.value: A string that is intended to be converted into braille.

ElementInternalsAriaLevel.summary: The ariaLevel property of the interface reflects the value of the aria-level attribute, which defines the hierarchical level of an element within a structure.

blockquote.para: Setting aria attributes on ElementInternals allows default semantics to be defined on a custom element. These may be overwritten by author-defined attributes, but ensure that default semantics are retained should the author delete those attributes, or fail to add them at all. For more information see the Accessibility Object Model explainer.

remarks.para: -ARIA: heading role

ElementInternalsForm.summary: The form read-only property of the interface returns the associated with this element.

ElementInternalsAriaInvalid.summary: The ariaInvalid property of the interface reflects the value of the aria-invalid attribute. Relevant for the application, checkbox, combobox, gridcell, listbox, radiogroup, slider, spinbutton, textbox, and tree roles, it indicates to the accessibility API whether the entered value does not conform to the format expected by the application.

blockquote.para: Setting ARIA attributes on ElementInternals allows default semantics to be defined on a custom element. These may be overwritten by author-defined attributes, but ensure that default semantics are retained should the author delete those attributes, or fail to add them at all. For more information see the Accessibility Object Model explainer.

remarks.para:
-
-aria-required
-aria-errormessage

ElementInternalsAriaInvalid.value: A string with one of the following values:

ElementInternalsAriaReadOnly.summary: The ariaReadOnly property of the interface reflects the value of the aria-readonly attribute, which indicates that the element is not editable, but is otherwise operable.

blockquote.para: Setting aria attributes on ElementInternals allows default semantics to be defined on a custom element. These may be overwritten by author-defined attributes, but ensure that default semantics are retained should the author delete those attributes, or fail to add them at all. For more information see the Accessibility Object Model explainer.

remarks.para: -ARIA: textbox role

ElementInternalsAriaReadOnly.value: A string with one of the following values:

ElementInternalsAriaRelevant.summary: CAUTION Non-standard The ariaRelevant property of the interface reflects the value of the aria-relevant attribute, which indicates what notifications the user agent will trigger when the accessibility tree within a live region is modified. This is used to describe what changes in an aria-live region are relevant and should be announced.

blockquote.para: Setting aria attributes on ElementInternals allows default semantics to be defined on a custom element. These may be overwritten by author-defined attributes, but ensure that default semantics are retained should the author delete those attributes, or fail to add them at all. For more information see the Accessibility Object Model explainer.

ElementInternalsAriaRelevant.value: A string containing one or more of the following values, space separated:

ElementInternalsAriaValueNow.summary: The ariaValueNow property of the interface reflects the value of the aria-valuenow attribute, which defines the current value for a range widget.

blockquote.para: Setting aria attributes on ElementInternals allows default semantics to be defined on a custom element. These may be overwritten by author-defined attributes, but ensure that default semantics are retained should the author delete those attributes, or fail to add them at all. For more information see the Accessibility Object Model explainer.

ElementInternalsAriaValueNow.value: A string which contains a number.

ElementInternalsRole.summary: The role read-only property of the interface returns the WAI-ARIA role for the element. For example, a checkbox might have role="checkbox". It reflects the role attribute; it does not return the element's implicit ARIA role, if any, unless explicitly set.
ElementInternalsRole.value: A string which contains an ARIA role. A full list of ARIA roles can be found on the ARIA techniques page.

ElementInternalsAriaMultiSelectable.summary: The ariaMultiSelectable property of the interface reflects the value of the aria-multiselectable attribute, which indicates that the user may select more than one item from the current selectable descendants.

blockquote.para: Setting aria attributes on ElementInternals allows default semantics to be defined on a custom element. These may be overwritten by author-defined attributes, but ensure that default semantics are retained should the author delete those attributes, or fail to add them at all. For more information see the Accessibility Object Model explainer.

remarks.para: -ARIA: listbox role

ElementInternalsAriaMultiSelectable.value: A string with one of the following values:

ElementInternalsAriaDetailsElements.summary:
The ariaDetailsElements property of the interface is an array containing the element (or elements) that provide an accessible details for the element it is applied to.
The accessible details are similar to the accessible description (see ), but provides more verbose information.

remarks.para: The aria-details topic contains additional information about how the attribute and property should be used.

-aria-details attribute
-
-Reflected element references in the Attribute reflection guide.

ElementInternalsAriaDetailsElements.value:
An array of subclasses of .
The inner text of these elements can be joined with spaces to get the accessible details.When read, the returned array is a static and read-only.
When written, the assigned array is copied: subsequent changes to the array do not affect the value of the property.

ElementInternalsAriaRowIndex.summary: The ariaRowIndex property of the interface reflects the value of the aria-rowindex attribute, which defines an element's row index or position with respect to the total number of rows within a table, grid, or treegrid.

blockquote.para: Setting aria attributes on ElementInternals allows default semantics to be defined on a custom element. These may be overwritten by author-defined attributes, but ensure that default semantics are retained should the author delete those attributes, or fail to add them at all. For more information see the Accessibility Object Model explainer.

remarks.para: -ARIA: table role

ElementInternalsAriaRowIndex.value: A string which contains an integer.

ElementInternalsAriaRoleDescription.summary: The ariaRoleDescription property of the interface reflects the value of the aria-roledescription attribute, which defines a human-readable, author-localized description for the role of an element.

blockquote.para: Setting aria attributes on ElementInternals allows default semantics to be defined on a custom element. These may be overwritten by author-defined attributes, but ensure that default semantics are retained should the author delete those attributes, or fail to add them at all. For more information see the Accessibility Object Model explainer.

remarks.para: -ARIA: application role

ElementInternalsAriaColSpan.summary: The ariaColSpan property of the interface reflects the value of the aria-colspan attribute, which defines the number of columns spanned by a cell or gridcell within a table, grid, or treegrid.

blockquote.para: Setting aria attributes on ElementInternals allows default semantics to be defined on a custom element. These may be overwritten by author-defined attributes, but ensure that default semantics are retained should the author delete those attributes, or fail to add them at all. For more information see the Accessibility Object Model explainer.

remarks.para: -ARIA: table role

ElementInternalsAriaColSpan.value: A string which contains an integer.

ElementInternalsAriaColCount.summary: The ariaColCount property of the interface reflects the value of the aria-colcount attribute, which defines the number of columns in a table, grid, or treegrid.

blockquote.para: Setting aria attributes on ElementInternals allows default semantics to be defined on a custom element. These may be overwritten by author-defined attributes, but ensure that default semantics are retained should the author delete those attributes, or fail to add them at all. For more information see the Accessibility Object Model explainer.

remarks.para: -ARIA: table role

ElementInternalsAriaPressed.summary: The ariaPressed property of the interface reflects the value of the aria-pressed attribute, which indicates the current "pressed" state of toggle buttons.

blockquote.para: Setting aria attributes on ElementInternals allows default semantics to be defined on a custom element. These may be overwritten by author-defined attributes, but ensure that default semantics are retained should the author delete those attributes, or fail to add them at all. For more information see the Accessibility Object Model explainer.

remarks.para: -ARIA: button role

ElementInternalsAriaPressed.value: A string with one of the following values:

ElementInternalsShadowRoot.summary: The shadowRoot read-only property of the interface returns the for this element.
ElementInternalsShadowRoot.value: A if the element has a shadow root, otherwise null.

ElementInternalsAriaDescription.summary: The ariaDescription property of the interface reflects the value of the aria-description attribute, which defines a string value that describes or annotates the current element.

blockquote.para: Setting aria attributes on ElementInternals allows default semantics to be defined on a custom element. These may be overwritten by author-defined attributes, but ensure that default semantics are retained should the author delete those attributes, or fail to add them at all. For more information see the Accessibility Object Model explainer.

ElementInternalsAriaValueText.summary: The ariaValueText property of the interface reflects the value of the aria-valuetext attribute, which defines the human-readable text alternative of aria-valuenow for a range widget.

blockquote.para: Setting aria attributes on ElementInternals allows default semantics to be defined on a custom element. These may be overwritten by author-defined attributes, but ensure that default semantics are retained should the author delete those attributes, or fail to add them at all. For more information see the Accessibility Object Model explainer.

ElementInternalsAriaHasPopup.summary: The ariaHasPopup property of the interface reflects the value of the aria-haspopup attribute, which indicates the availability and type of interactive popup element, such as menu or dialog, that can be triggered by an element.

blockquote.para: Setting aria attributes on ElementInternals allows default semantics to be defined on a custom element. These may be overwritten by author-defined attributes, but ensure that default semantics are retained should the author delete those attributes, or fail to add them at all. For more information see the Accessibility Object Model explainer.

ElementInternalsAriaHasPopup.value: A string with one of the following values:

ElementInternalsAriaFlowToElements.summary:
The ariaFlowToElements property of the interface is an array containing the element (or elements) that provide an alternate reading order of content, overriding the general default reading order at the user's discretion.
If just one element is provided this is the next element in the reading order.
If multiple elements are provided, then each element represents a possible path that should be offered to the user for selection.

remarks.para: The aria-flowto topic contains additional information about how the attribute and property should be used.

-aria-flowto attribute
-
-Reflected element references in the Attribute reflection guide.

ElementInternalsAriaFlowToElements.value:
An array of subclasses of .When read, the returned array is a static and read-only.
When written, the assigned array is copied: subsequent changes to the array do not affect the value of the property.

ElementInternalsSetFormValue.summary: The setFormValue() method of the interface sets the element's submission value and state, communicating these to the user agent.

ElementInternalsAriaPosInSet.summary: The ariaPosInSet property of the interface reflects the value of the aria-posinset attribute, which defines an element's number or position in the current set of listitems or treeitems.

blockquote.para: Setting aria attributes on ElementInternals allows default semantics to be defined on a custom element. These may be overwritten by author-defined attributes, but ensure that default semantics are retained should the author delete those attributes, or fail to add them at all. For more information see the Accessibility Object Model explainer.

ElementInternalsStates.summary: The states read-only property of the interface returns a representing the possible states of the custom element.
ElementInternalsStates.value: A which is a {{jsxref("Set")}} of strings.

ElementInternalsCheckValidity.summary: The checkValidity() method of the interface checks if the element meets any constraint validation rules applied to it.

remarks.para: If checkValidity returns false then a cancelable invalid event is fired on the element.

ElementInternalsCheckValidity.returns: A boolean value, true if the element meets all validation constraints.

ElementInternalsReportValidity.summary: The reportValidity() method of the interface checks if the element meets any constraint validation rules applied to it.

remarks.para: If reportValidity returns false then a cancelable invalid event is fired on the element.
This method behaves in a similar way to , however it additionally sends the value of to the user agent for display.

ElementInternalsReportValidity.returns: A boolean value, true if the element meets all validation constraints.

ElementInternalsAriaSelected.summary: The ariaSelected property of the interface reflects the value of the aria-selected attribute, which indicates the current "selected" state of elements that have a selected state.

blockquote.para: Setting aria attributes on ElementInternals allows default semantics to be defined on a custom element. These may be overwritten by author-defined attributes, but ensure that default semantics are retained should the author delete those attributes, or fail to add them at all. For more information see the Accessibility Object Model explainer.

remarks.para: -ARIA: tab role

ElementInternalsAriaSelected.value: A string with one of the following values:

ElementInternalsAriaHidden.summary: The ariaHidden property of the interface reflects the value of the aria-hidden attribute, which indicates whether the element is exposed to an accessibility API.

blockquote.para: Setting aria attributes on ElementInternals allows default semantics to be defined on a custom element. These may be overwritten by author-defined attributes, but ensure that default semantics are retained should the author delete those attributes, or fail to add them at all. For more information see the Accessibility Object Model explainer.

ElementInternalsAriaHidden.value: A string with one of the following values:

ElementInternalsAriaValueMin.summary: The ariaValueMin property of the interface reflects the value of the aria-valuemin attribute, which defines the minimum allowed value for a range widget.

blockquote.para: Setting aria attributes on ElementInternals allows default semantics to be defined on a custom element. These may be overwritten by author-defined attributes, but ensure that default semantics are retained should the author delete those attributes, or fail to add them at all. For more information see the Accessibility Object Model explainer.

ElementInternalsAriaValueMin.value: A string which contains a number.

ElementInternalsAriaLabelledByElements.summary: The ariaLabelledByElements property of the interface is an array containing the element (or elements) that provide an accessible name for the element it is applied to.

remarks.para:
The property is primarily intended to provide a label for elements that don't have a standard method for defining their accessible name.
For example, this might be used to name a generic container element, such as a div or span, or a grouping of elements, such as an image with a slider that can be used to change its opacity.
The property takes precedence over other mechanisms for providing an accessible name for elements, and may therefore also be used to provide a name for elements that would normally get it from their inner content or from an associated element such as a label.
The aria-labelledby topic contains additional information about how the attribute and property should be used.

-aria-labelledby attribute
-
-Reflected element references in the Attribute reflection guide.

ElementInternalsAriaLabelledByElements.value:
An array of elements.
The inner text of these elements can be joined with spaces to get the accessible name.When read, the returned array is a static and read-only.
When written, the assigned array is copied: subsequent changes to the array do not affect the value of the property.

ElementInternalsAriaOwnsElements.summary:
The ariaOwnsElements property of the interface is an array containing the element (or elements) that define a visual, functional, or contextual relationship between a parent element that it is applied to, and its child elements.
This is used when the shadow DOM hierarchy cannot be used to represent the relationship, and it would not otherwise be available to assistive technology,

remarks.para: The aria-owns topic contains additional information about how the attribute and property should be used.

-aria-owns attribute
-
-Reflected element references in the Attribute reflection guide.

ElementInternalsAriaOwnsElements.value:
An array of subclasses of .When read, the returned array is a static and read-only.
When written, the assigned array is copied: subsequent changes to the array do not affect the value of the property.

ElementInternalsAriaErrorMessageElements.summary: The ariaErrorMessageElements property of the interface is an array containing the element (or elements) that provide an error message for the element it is applied to.

remarks.para: The aria-errormessage topic contains additional information about how the attribute and property should be used.

-aria-errormessage attribute
-
-Reflected element references in the Attribute reflection guide.

ElementInternalsAriaErrorMessageElements.value:
An array of subclasses of .
The inner text of these elements can be joined with spaces to get the error message.When read, the returned array is a static and read-only.
When written, the assigned array is copied: subsequent changes to the array do not affect the value of the property.

ElementInternalsLabels.summary: The labels read-only property of the interface returns the labels associated with the element.
ElementInternalsLabels.value: A containing all of the label elements associated with this element.

ElementInternalsAriaRowCount.summary: The ariaRowCount property of the interface reflects the value of the aria-rowcount attribute, which defines the total number of rows in a table, grid, or treegrid.

blockquote.para: Setting aria attributes on ElementInternals allows default semantics to be defined on a custom element. These may be overwritten by author-defined attributes, but ensure that default semantics are retained should the author delete those attributes, or fail to add them at all. For more information see the Accessibility Object Model explainer.

remarks.para: -ARIA: table role

ElementInternalsAriaRowCount.value: A string which contains an integer.

ElementInternalsValidationMessage.summary: The validationMessage read-only property of the interface returns the validation message for the element.
ElementInternalsValidationMessage.value: A string containing the validation message of this element.

ElementInternalsAriaValueMax.summary: The ariaValueMax property of the interface reflects the value of the aria-valuemax attribute, which defines the maximum allowed value for a range widget.

blockquote.para: Setting aria attributes on ElementInternals allows default semantics to be defined on a custom element. These may be overwritten by author-defined attributes, but ensure that default semantics are retained should the author delete those attributes, or fail to add them at all. For more information see the Accessibility Object Model explainer.

ElementInternalsAriaValueMax.value: A string which contains a number.

ElementInternalsAriaCurrent.summary: The ariaCurrent property of the interface reflects the value of the aria-current attribute, which indicates the element that represents the current item within a container or set of related elements.

blockquote.para: Setting aria attributes on ElementInternals allows default semantics to be defined on a custom element. These may be overwritten by author-defined attributes, but ensure that default semantics are retained should the author delete those attributes, or fail to add them at all. For more information see the Accessibility Object Model explainer.

remarks.para: -Using the aria-current attribute

ElementInternalsAriaCurrent.value: A string with one of the following values:

ElementInternalsAriaKeyShortcuts.summary: The ariaKeyShortcuts property of the interface reflects the value of the aria-keyshortcuts attribute, which indicates keyboard shortcuts that an author has implemented to activate or give focus to an element.

blockquote.para: Setting aria attributes on ElementInternals allows default semantics to be defined on a custom element. These may be overwritten by author-defined attributes, but ensure that default semantics are retained should the author delete those attributes, or fail to add them at all. For more information see the Accessibility Object Model explainer.

ElementInternalsAriaLabel.summary: The ariaLabel property of the interface reflects the value of the aria-label attribute, which defines a string value that labels the current Element.

blockquote.para: Setting aria attributes on ElementInternals allows default semantics to be defined on a custom element. These may be overwritten by author-defined attributes, but ensure that default semantics are retained should the author delete those attributes, or fail to add them at all. For more information see the Accessibility Object Model explainer.
